patterns: What do you know about Institute of Business Administration?
Please share some information regarding IBA
How is Institute of Business Administration?
responses: IBA is the oldest business school outside North America. It was established in 1955 with initial technical support provided by the world famous Wharton School of Finance, University of Pennsylvania.
90% of IBA students have job offers before their convocation.
Students of IBA run 27 Societies that organizes learning conferences, competitions and various activities, which makes them independent event organizers and groom their leadership skills.

IBA has expanded; it's not just a business school. It now proudly offers a Computer Studies Programme up to PhD level, a Programme in Accounting Economics and Finance / Mathematics, a Programme in Islamic Banking & Finance, and last but not the least a Social Sciences and Liberal Arts Programme.
IBA has State of the art physical and technical infrastructure, where thirty five new projects are completed and running.

patterns: How many societies are there in the institute?
What type of societies are at IBA?
What about co-curriculur activities at university?
responses: Currently, there are 21 student societies and clubs operating within IBA, under the Office of Student Societies. They allow students to explore and pursue their interests outside of the academic sphere leading to a holistic development of character, ethics and morals that IBA promises to instill in its student body. There are many different types of societies including Accounting club, Marketing club, Entrpreneurship society and many more.

patterns: Tell me about the faculty at the university.
How are the teachers at IBA?
responses: IBA has 80 full time and 85 part time and visiting faculty members teaching courses in Management, Marketing, HR, Strategy, Finance, Economics, Quantitative Methods, Organizational Behavior, Computer Sciences, Ethics, Social Sciences, Chinese, Arabic. These faculties are divided into departments: Dept of Accounting and Law, Dept of Economics & Finance, Dept of Management, Dept of Marketing, Dept of Social Sciences, Dept of Computer Science, and Dept of Mathematical Sciences.

patterns: What level of programs does the institute offer?
What level of programs does this university offer?
What type of programs are being offered?
responses: IBA offers programmes for all three levels: Undergraduate, Graduate, and Post-Graduate. Which level of programs would you like to know about?

patterns: Tell me about some undergraduate programs
What undergraduate programs are on offer?
Tell me about some bachelors programs.
What bachelors programs are on offer.
responses: IBA has 6 undergraduate programs: BBA, BS Computer Science, BS Accounting & Finance, BS Economics & Mathematics, BS Economics, BS Social Sciences.

patterns: Tell me about some graduate programs
What masters programs are on offer
Tell me about some masters programs
What graduate programs are on offer
responses: IBA has 8 graduate programs: MBA, MBA Executive, MS Computer Science, MS Economics, MS Mathematics, MS Islamic Banking & Finance, MS Management, MS Journlism.

patterns: Tell me about some post graduate programs
What post graduate programs are on offer
Tell me about some PHD programs
What PHD programs are on offer
responses: IBA has 3 post-graduate programs: Phd Computer Science, Phd Economics, Phd Mathematics.

patterns: What is the requirement to apply?
Am I eligible for applying into IBA?
responses: For which level of program?

You need 2Bs and 1C in your A'Level or 65% in your Intermediate exams for BBA.
For all other BS programs, you need 1B and 2Cs in your A'Level or 60% in your Intermediate exams.
You need minimum of 2.50 CGPA out of 4.00 in your undergraduate program for any MS program or MBA.
You need minimum of 3.00 CGPA out of 4.00 in your graduate program for any Phd program.

You need 2Bs and 1C in your A'Level or 65% in your Intermediate exams for BBA.
For all other BS programs, you need 1B and 2Cs in your A'Level or 60% in your Intermediate exams.
You need minimum of 2.50 CGPA out of 4.00 in your undergraduate program for any MS program or MBA.
You need minimum of 3.00 CGPA out of 4.00 in your graduate program for any Phd program.

patterns: What is the total fee per semester?
responses: For which level of program?
Currently, IBA charges Rs. 237,500/- per semester for BBA and BS ACF. While, for all other BS programs, the fee per semester is Rs. 199,500/-.

patterns: per semester fee For Masters level.
responses: For MBA (Morning), IBA charges Rs. 237,500/- per semester. For all other MS programs, the fee per semester is Rs. 122,500/-.
A full tuition fee waiver and monthly stipend.

patterns: fee for every level of programs.
responses:
Currently, IBA charges Rs. 237,500/- per semester for BBA and BS ACF. While, for all other BS programs, the fee per semester is Rs. 199,500/-.
For MBA (Morning), IBA charges Rs. 237,500/- per semester. For all other MS programs, the fee per semester is Rs. 122,500/-.
A full tuition fee waiver and monthly stipend for all Phd programs.
Visit https://admissions.iba.edu.pk/OfferedPrograms.php for more information.

patterns: Is there any waiver for BS and MS programs in fee in the university?
responses: Yes, you can get a big support in terms of Financial aid. IBA offers a few Financial Assistance Packages: Instalment Plan; Deferment of Fees; Need based Financial Assistance / Scholarships; Study loans; Work-study Appointment Scheme
